data.title: Electoral history of David Cameron
data.text:
List of elections featuring David Cameron as a candidate

This is a summary of the electoral history of David Cameron, who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 2010 to 2016 and Leader of the Conservative Party from 2005 to 2016, and as Foreign Secretary in the Sunak ministry since 2023. He was also the member of parliament (MP) for Witney from 2001 to 2016.

Parliamentary elections

[edit]

1997 general election, Stafford

[edit]

This section is transcluded from Stafford (UK Parliament constituency).

General election 1997: Stafford[1][2] Party Candidate Votes % Majority 4,314 8.3 N/A Turnout 51,772 76.6 –6.3 Labour gain from Conservative Swing +10.7

2001 general election, Witney

[edit]

This section is transcluded from Witney (UK Parliament constituency).

General election 2001: Witney[3] Party Candidate Votes % Majority 7,973 16.2 +3.8 Turnout 49,203 65.9 −10.8 Conservative hold Swing +1.9

2005 general election, Witney

[edit]

This section is transcluded from Witney (UK Parliament constituency).

General election 2005: Witney[4] Party Candidate Votes % Majority 14,156 26.3 +10.1 Turnout 53,869 69.0 +3.1 Conservative hold Swing +0.8

2010 general election, Witney

[edit]

This section is transcluded from Witney (UK Parliament constituency).

General election 2010: Witney[5] Party Candidate Votes % Majority 22,740 39.4 +12.5 Turnout 57,769 73.3 +4.3 Conservative hold Swing +6.3

2015 general election, Witney

[edit]

This section is transcluded from Witney (UK Parliament constituency).

General election 2015: Witney[6][7][8] Party Candidate Votes % Majority 25,155 43.0 +3.6 Turnout 58,482 73.3 0.0 Conservative hold Swing −1.4
